textfields.tf: When applying a 1-point control both sides of an axle are jointly controlled.
When applying a 2-point control the main axle and the front axle are separately controlled.
When applying a 2-point control two sides of an axle are separately controlled.
When applying a 1-point control on the front axle and a 2-point control on the rear axle this is referred to as 3-point control.
Which statements about the different types of control applied by ECAS are correct?
This statement ist true. When applying the 1-point control, both sides are equally pressurized or vented. On semitrailers this is the mostly applied control type.
This is wrong. 2-point control means to control two sides of an axle separately.
This statement is correct. When applying the 2-point control two sides are separately measured and controlled.
This is true. This 3-point control is applied on motor vehicles and in drawbar trailers.
You are right, you detected all appropriate statements.
